byline.original: By JONATHAN MARTIN and JEREMY W. PETERS

abstract: Republican contenders for 2016 presidential nomination are quickly shifting positions on foreign policy, responding to public anxiety over Islamic State, terrorist attacks in Europe and tension with Russia; many potential nominees are coming to favor more restrained foreign policy approach.
lead_paragraph: Republicans are scrambling to outmuscle one another on national security issues, potentially imperiling the candidacy of Senator Rand Paul, who favors a more restrained approach.

headline.main: Presidential Contenders in G.O.P. Shift Attention to Foreign Policy Issues
headline.print_headline: Presidential Contenders in G.O.P. Shift Attention to Foreign Policy Issues

snippet: Republicans are scrambling to outmuscle one another on national security issues, potentially imperiling the candidacy of Senator Rand Paul, who favors a more restrained approach.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
